intro: Pancheria laevis, commonly known as the smooth pancheria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Pancheria laevis is often found in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
